Featured Project

New York Proton Center

  • Next

Project Highlights

  • First proton center planned in New York City
  • Constrained footprint on tight urban site
  • Challenges related to staging of materials and equipment
  • Three floors of vertical layout
  • 3 Gantries, 1 Fixed beam room, 1 Eye chair, 1 Research
  • Equipment Vendor: Varian

Description

The Proton Center will be a new 3-story, 135,000 SF facility built on a 49,360 SF constrained urban site located in uptown Manhattan. The Center will contain three gantries, one fixed beam, one eye chair, and one research room, hemmed in between two existing buildings. Due to the lack of additional space necessary for staging of materials and equipment, the Owner has entered into an agreement with adjacent property owner to provide staging space for construction and installation.

The design of the NY Proton Center, which will utilize a cyclotron treatment system, will create a world class facility, providing proton radiation oncology treatment for patients in a healing environment.

Scope of Services

  • Provided proton therapy expertise to the Construction Manager (Gilbane Building Company) for the pre-construction and construction phases.
  • Assisted the CM and subcontractors with the development of the BIM model, schedule and sequencing, development of the mass concrete plan, development of a PT specific QA/QC plan, developed start-up and testing procedures and schedule, worked with the CM, Owner, and Varian on equipment readiness checklists.
  • Assisted Owner with negotiation of the BID responsibility Matrix.
